file_content.text: What are you waiting for, Jiyan? The Imperials lost too many troops in the raid. We have the advantage! We need to storm the temple!
If we storm the temple, Darth Arho might kill the supreme commander. We lost Commander Jub in the attack; we can't afford to lose Rans, too.
I agree. Commander Rans is our best strategist, and a hero to the troops. We have to find a way to save him.
Storming the temple is too risky. But maybe I can sneak my team inside without Arho finding out.
Havoc Squad can get him back.
You are no true warrior. Stealth and secrecy are the weapons of smugglers and thieves!
Sounds like another impossible mission for yours truly.
Am I about to be volunteered?
We should be looking to warriors and soldiers to save him, not smugglers and thieves!
Arho will be guarding against a direct assault, but I could sneak into the temple without him knowing.
Let me go; I'll get Rans back.
I thought the Jedi Knights were warriors. Why do you want us to sneak around like smugglers and thieves?
Where armies fail, a small group may succeed. It might be possible to infiltrate the temple and rescue Rans without alerting Arho.
We must trust in the Force.
That's the problem with Jedi. Compromise and half-measures. A real warrior doesn't need to sneak around like some kind of smuggler or thief!
Hey, you giant hair ball. I'm standing right here. Downwind. Big mistake on my part.
That Wookiee just insulted me!
We all serve the cause in our own way, Caroowar. We must remember this if we hope to... wait. What was that?
Smashing your head against a problem isn't the only way to solve it. Sometimes you need a plan.
A good warrior is smart, too.
We must remain calm, Caroowar. Remember: There is no emotion, only peace.
We can't turn on each other.
Don't throw the Jedi Code in my face! Words will not save... wait. What was that?
Jiyan Dar is in charge now that Rans is gone. We follow his orders.
Respect the chain of command!
Yes. You're right. I'm sorry. My temper sometimes... wait. What was that?
You must have friends in high places, Caroowar. I don't know how else a moron made commander.
Are all Wookiees this stupid?
Stop this! If we turn against each other we'll never... wait. What was that?
Hit the temple with everything we've got. Arho won't stand a chance.
The Wookiee's right.
No! The risk to Commander Rans is too great. We have to... wait. What was that?
Why do you think the Imperials captured Rans instead of killing him? They knew it would turn you against each other!
Arguing is what Arho wants.
You're right, we must remain calm. There is no emotion, only peace.
Meditation won't stop Arho. And it won't save... wait. What's that?
Rans is worm food. Better to accept it.
Forget it. He's dead.
He would not be so quick to abandon you! Maybe you should think about--
Incoming holotransmission. Urgent priority.
Greetings, Republic Commanders. My name is Darth Malgus. Time is short, so I will be blunt.
I've been providing Supreme Commander Rans information to help him defeat Darth Arho. I'm here to offer you the same.
Let me guess: Arho's one of your main rivals within the Empire, so you're using the Republic to eliminate him.
You were working with Rans?
More or less. The war is over. The Republic won. If we keep fighting, you will destroy us. I accept this. Darth Arho does not.
You were in charge of the prison where they were holding Revan! You tried to kill me!
I remember you!
Much has changed since we last met. The Empire is in disarray. The war is over. You won.
If we continue to fight, you will destroy us. I have accepted our new place in the galaxy. Darth Arho has not.
Why should I trust a Sith?
Why should we trust a Sith?
I'm a pragmatist. I know we lost the war. If we continue to fight, you will destroy us. I accept that. Arho does not.
He's a member of the Dark Council, but he's a thug. The Council needs someone more... progressive... if the Empire hopes to survive.
Someone like you, I suppose.
Openly opposing Arho would draw the wrath of the Dark Council. But by helping you eliminate him, we both get what we want.
Tell us how you're going to help.
Works for me.
You're a Sith. You use lies and deception to get what you want.
I don't believe you.
I'm only here to provide information. Whether you choose to use it is up to you.
If that's true, then maybe we don't want Arho off the Dark Council. He's doing more damage than we ever could.
Sounds like Arho's helping us.
True. But how many lives will he throw away in war before his inevitable fall? Together we can stop this bloodshed.
What about Commander Rans? What happened to him? Is he still alive?
They're holding him in a secret POW camp. The perimeter is ringed with droid-defended security towers. Any breach will set off the alarm.
You have one minute, Malgus.
Arho suspects Rans is working with someone on the Imperial side. Obviously, I'm eager to keep my role in all this quiet.
They're holding your Supreme Commander in a secret POW camp. Droid-defended security towers ring the perimeter. Any breach will trigger the alarm.
I'm transmitting the location of the camp and the codes to disable the tower alarms. Use them as you see fit.
This could be a trap, but I think it's worth the risk.
We have to use those codes.
Don't be a fool! Malgus and Arho are working together. They set this whole thing up to lure us into an ambush!
Are we really going to trust a Sith Lord?
I'm not sure what to think.
This won't end well.
If we know anything about the Sith, it's that they're always at each other's throats.
We can trust Malgus for one reason: He's acting out of self-interest. He hates Darth Arho more than he hates us.
We'll send troops out to strike at key Imperial targets. That should draw most of Arho's troops away from the prison camp.
You head to the camp and use the codes to neutralize the defense towers on the perimeter. Once they're down, infiltrate the camp and get Rans out of there.
They won't keep Rans alive forever. Go take out the towers on the prison camp's perimeter.
